string.text: Rat Skewers

Small skewered tushkanos, grilled and seasoned with salt and various herbs. The cheapest hot meal available in the Zone.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Dog Chops

A small hot meal of grilled dog chops mixed with various herbs. A cheap alternative to the more popular boar beef.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Pseudodog Chops

Portion of grilled pseudodog meat chops. Good nutritional value due to the creature's thick muscles.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Flesh Bacon

Slices of greasy, fat bacon cut from the mutated pigs in the zone, commonly referred to as 'fleshes'.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Boar Chops

A small portion of boar meat, grilled and seasoned with salt and various herbs. The most popular warm meal among stalkers.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Bloodsucker Goulash

A small hot meal made from bloodsucker meat, spiced with various herbs and mushrooms.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Psysucker Goulash

A small hot meal made from psysucker meat, spiced with various herbs and mushrooms.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Grilled Snork Hand

Grilled snork hand, ready to be eaten.
 
WARNING: Most stalkers consider eating snork meat to be cannibalistic and immoral. However, certain factions, such as bandits and mercenaries, include it in their meals to show their superiority over other groups.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
The Masculine Meal

A portion of grilled chimera meat, served with mushrooms and various spices. An expensive meal, eaten most commonly by veteran Stalkers to celebrate the accomplishment of difficult missions.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Lurker Chops

A small portion of lurker meat, grilled and seasoned with salt and various herbs. Good nutritional value due to the mutants thick muscles.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
Flesh Meat

A popular choice in the Zone. Flesh meat has a good taste and high nutritional value. The scientists have enough samples already, which limits its use as a commodity. However, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
 %c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Boar Chop

The most popular meat in the Zone. Nutritious and hardly contaminated. The scientists have enough samples already, which limits its use as a commodity. However, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Dog Meat

Meat of mutated dogs is used as a cheap alternative to the more popular boar meat. The scientists have enough samples already, which limits its use as a commodity. However, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Pseudodog Meat

Pseudodog meat is a common dietary component in the Zone. Tasty, with high nutritional value and a popular choice among stalkers. Can be sold to the scientists. Moreover, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Bloodsucker Meat

Bloodsucker meat is stringy and thus not suited for eating. Although bloodsuckers are fearsome beasts, the price of the meat is not very high due to its limited use. Can be sold to the scientists. Moreover, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Psysucker Meat

Similar to bloodsuckers, Psysucker meat is stringy and thus not suited for eating. The price of the meat is not very high due to its limited use. Can be sold to the scientists. Moreover, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Snork Hand

As is widely known, snorks originate from humans, so eating their meat is considered cannibalistic and immoral. However, certain factions, such as bandits and mercenaries, include it in their meals as to show their superiority over other groups. Can be sold to the scientists.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Fracture Hand

A severed hand of a fracture - an extremely deformed humanoid mutant. It is certain that these creatures used to be humans and are the direct result of the second Chernobyl incident. From the remains of their clothing we can deduce that fractures originate from prisoner population that was stationed in the Exclusion Zone and sentenced to forced labour. All specimens encountered so far were male and sterile. Hence it can be safely assumed that the fracture population is unable to reproduce, and their number in the Zone will be steadily dwindling. For this reason, at present they remain one of the most rarely encountered types of mutant.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Zombie Hand

The hand of a zombie, a former human beings who lived or worked in the Exclusion Zone and were subjected to extreme amounts of radiation and psy-influence when the second Chernobyl incident occurred. After many years, they resemble re-animated dead bodies, however they are very much alive and almost permanently hungry and thus can become a threat when encountered in packs. A zombie hand not only constitutes a scientific research material but in many cases can also be used to identify the person to whom the hand belonged.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Chunk of Chimera Meat

A heavy chunk of chimera meat. Since chimeras are considered one of the most dangerous creatures, their meat is highly valued by veteran stalkers. Furthermore, it provides the best quality animal fat available in the Zone for the purposes of gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Lurker Meat

A chunk of lurker meat. Nutritious and hardly contaminated. However, it can also serve as a source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Rodent Meat

A small portion of rodent meat. A cheap and commonly found food.
 
%c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
Flesh Eye

The mutated, swollen eye of a flesh which has the miraculous ability of repairing even severe damage sustained to the organ. The discovery of the mechanism behind it would most certainly revolutionize modern medicine by providing cures for many diseases.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Boar Leg

A leg of a Boar. The hoofs of boars found in the zone have been used to produce various drugs, for example anti-radiation serums.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Dog Tail

Resistance of mutant dog's skin to electricity and chemical agents have been the object of scientific interest for a long time. Due to the absence of fat tissue, the tail is especially suited for lab tests.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Pseudodog Tail

Rumour has it that a certain trend has recently taken over the fashion world: fur from the tails of pseudodogs. The fur is reportedly incredibly soft and will keep you warm even in the most vicious snowstorms and blizzards. For these reasons, pseudodog tails are in high demand.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Bloodsucker Jaw

Bloodsucker tentacles contain a special gland which produces an enzyme capable of dissolving the skin and simultaneously preventing blood from clotting. Discovering the enzyme's composition could be the cornerstone of a whole series of great medical advances. Some stalkers tend to use bloodsucker teeth to make necklaces and charms.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Snork Leg

Snork feet and legs contain a huge number of highly elastic tendons. This explains the beast's ability to perform its characteristically long leaps. The scientists will be grateful for each specimen you bring to their base.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Chimera Horn

The horn of a chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but its tip is as durable and sharp as a diamond. This item is in high demand as it is visibly similar to a rhino horn.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Chimera Claw

The claw of a chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but we know for a fact that it is as durable and sharp as a diamond, explaining why the beast is able to cut through armor with ease.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Lurker Eye

A mutated eye of a lurker. The glow surrounding the pupil made the lurker's eye a matter of interest among local hunters. The scientists still look for potential uses.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Lurker Tail

Scientific studies suggest that the characteristics of a lurker tail are proof that their are, in fact, a mutant species of tushkano.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Psysucker Hand

Psysuckers are known for their skinny hands and long fingers. It seems that the skin around the fingertips is badly torn, which explains all the blood covering the fingers. The scientists will gladly examine it in the hope of finding the source responsible for its psy-related powers.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Tushkano Head

The head of a tushkano. The scientists would like to study it to identify which creature or creatures tushkanos originate from.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Controller Brain Tissue

Controllers have potent mental powers and it is safe to say that these powers originate from the brain. Scientific studies have found that every mutant possessing abilities related to psy-waves have a brain of similar structure. The scientists will pay handsomely for this tissue.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Controller Hand

The controller seems to use its hand when mentally attacking its prey. The scientists will gladly examine it in the hope of finding the source of mutation responsible for its psy-related powers.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Cat Tail

Cats in the Zone are bigger than their pet cousins and are very dangerous predators, capable of moving swiftly and without sound. Within the stalker community, a cat's tail is a symbol of awareness and competency.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Pseudogiant Hand

A hand of a pseudogiant. It may prove useful for the scientists of the zone. Due to the inhumane physical powers of these dangerous behemoths, it is understandable that a specimen like this is rare to come by.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Pseudogiant Eye

The eye of the pseudogiant has the appearance of a human eye, albeit larger, but with a few key differences; a multi-coloured iris and exceptionally well-developed tear glands. In any case, the scientists would be very eager to lay their hands on it, so they're willing to pay a high price for any specimen.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Burer Hand

Burer's hands seem to play a vital role in the creature's use of their telekinetic powers. Scientists will gladly examine it in hope of finding the source of mutation.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Mutated Crow Beak

While many stalkers consider crows no more than pests, more insightful individuals acknowledge their usefulness in tackling the many challenges the Zone presents. While murders of crows can prove invaluable navigating and evading danger on the empty streets of Chernobyl and Pripyat, including the arrival of incoming emission storms, it's only after their death when their true value is manifested: pulverized beaks can be used to create a special mixture.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Snork Mask

Masks worn by snorks are apparently a version of the GP-5, a Soviet gas mask commonly used by soldiers as well as research and utility crews operating in the Zone when the second Chernobyl disaster occurred. The mask, although broken beyond use, is still in demand by the scientific community. It can also be used to repair parts of outfits, but this process results in all remaining organic material being lost.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Dog Liver

The liver of a dog, having undergone severe changes due to a toxic diet and a lack of clean drinking water in the Zone. The liver is of particular interest to scientists due to its potential in aiding research in medicine for liver diseases.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Dog Heart

While in pursuit, a blind dog's heart can reach up to 250 beats per minute, which is unthinkable for non-atherogenic healthy individuals of the same weight category. This endurance makes their heart an interesting subject for study, but because of its prevalence, the value for it among scientists are very small.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Cat Thyroid

The thyroid gland of local cats have multiplied in size due to sustained occupancy within the exclusion zone. This resulted in the need for increased food intake, increased activity, behaviour changes and hair loss. These traits have allowed the creatures to quickly displace their healthy relatives and occupy a higher position in the food chain.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Cat Claw

Cat's claws have an unknown structure but are known to be very sharp. Scientists and military believe that a thorough study will help in the creation of new, highly durable materials and armor.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Boar Fang

Posing a considerable threat to anything caught in its way, the boar fangs of the exclusion zone spans an average length of 30 centimeters. It is of no particular interest to scientists in the Zone due to its lackluster composition and strength. The fang is commonly used as a trophy among stalkers and has become a collector's item outside of the Zone.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Bloodsucker Heart

Bloodsucker's hearts secrete special enzymes which halt the coagulation process caused by incompatible blood types. Scientific study of the enzyme could allow scientists to solve the problem of blood donor issue for patients with rare blood types.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Pseudodog Fang

Pseudodog fangs are not particularly strong and are routinely replaced throughout life. Scientists are not particularly interested in them though they are often collected within the Zone.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Burer Brain

Burer's have telepathic skills yet unstudied by the science community. The brain's mass is 1.5 to 2.5 times bigger than a human brain. Though because of its size and structure, the brain can be easily damaged during extraction. These are highly sought-after in the scientific community.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Chimera Heart

The heart of a chimera has grown into a double-organ that can function as a reserve blood supply. Of interest to scientists is its incredible regeneration rate, providing the chimera with the ability to stay in combat even after sustaining heavy injuries. It is sought after to aid in the study Siamese twin death rates.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Psi-Dog Brain

Psi-Dogs have powerful physic abilities, for example, the ability to induce "hallucinations" upon prey. These illusions are extremely convincing, often capable of inflicting very real trauma through currently unknown means. Interestingly, scientists say that while they've identified the region of the brain responsible for the psionic abilities, it's evident that the region is "juvenile" in both development and evolutionary potential. Scientists will pay generously for samples of such tissues. 
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
Horse Meat

A piece of meat, high in both nutrition and, unfortunately, radiation. The scientists have enough samples already, which limits its use as a commodity. Source of animal fat for gun lubrication.
 
 %c[d_red]WARNING: %c[ui_gray_2]Stalkers are advised to refrain from eating raw meat as animals and mutants in the Zone are likely to be highly contaminated.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] not cookable
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] toxic food
 %c[d_red] • %c[ui_gray_2] radiation poisoning: %c[ui_gray_2] +646 mSv
Horse Tail

A long, frayed tail, presumably from a local horse. The scientists have enough samples already, which limits its use as a commodity.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_orange] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
